definition: surname Adorno/Theodor Ludwig Wiesengrund Adorno 狄奧多·阿多諾|狄奥多·阿多诺[Di2 ao4 duo1 · A1 duo1 nuo4] (1903-1969), German sociologist, philosopher, musicologist, and composer
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
Theodor Ludwig Wiesengrund Adorno (1903-1969), German sociologist, philosopher, musicologist, and composer
pinyin: Di2 ao4 duo1 · A1 duo1 nuo4

sentences.english: Adorno attempts to build real nature aesthetics.
sentences.chinese: 阿多諾力圖建立真正的自然美學。

sentences.english: Then we think of Adorno, who has a unique theory about culture industry.
sentences.chinese: 由此聯想到阿多諾，此人有自己獨特的文化工業理論。

sentences.english: Two of its most famous names were Max Horkheimer and Theodor Adorno.
sentences.chinese: 它的兩個最有名的名字是霍克海默和西奧多阿多諾。

sentences.english: Adorno and Benjamin, as I say, were very close friends.
sentences.chinese: 我剛纔說過，阿多諾和本傑明是好朋友。

sentences.english: Adorno, in the meantime, had gone to the United States.
The art philosophy of Adorno occupies an important position in the academic community of the West.
sentences.chinese: 在西方學術界，阿多諾的藝術哲學佔有相當重要地位。

definition: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
